abstract.p: Bell Canada International Inc and Telefonos de Mexico SA form new company with $3.5 billion in assets to expand in South America, primarily in broadband, mobile wireless and Internet services (S)

block.p: Two North American telephone giants, Bell Canada International Inc. and Telefonos de Mexico S.A., have formed a new company with $3.5 billion in assets to expand in South America, primarily in broadband, mobile wireless and Internet services. Bell Canada International is a subsidiary of BCE Inc., which owns Canada's largest telephone company, and Telefonos is the biggest telephone company in Mexico. The new company will include Bell Canada's existing investments in Brazil, Columbia and Venezuela and the Brazilian holdings of Telefonos, plus $1.8 billion in cash.
